meanings.sent1: The old boat had a bilgy smell coming from its hull.
meanings.sent2: The bilgy liquid sloshed around in the bottom of the ship.
meanings.sent3: The bilgy water in the bucket made everyone wrinkle their noses.
meanings.sent4: The pond looked bilgy, like a forgotten swamp.
meanings.sent5: The bilgy odor lingered in the air long after the boat had left.

meanings.sent1: The bilgy tank needed to be emptied before the next voyage.
meanings.sent2: The bilgy hold of the ship needed to be cleaned out regularly.
meanings.sent3: The bilgy puddle near the dock attracted mosquitoes.
meanings.sent4: The bilgy room was a breeding ground for mold and mildew.
meanings.sent5: The bilgy bilge water spilled out onto the deck, creating a slippery mess.

meanings.sent1: The bilgy socks left a trail of stench wherever they went.
meanings.sent2: The bilgy garbage can needed to be emptied immediately.
meanings.sent3: The bilgy alley behind the restaurant was avoided by all.
meanings.sent4: The bilgy smell of the sewer wafted up through the grate.
meanings.sent5: The bilgy kitchen was in desperate need of a thorough cleaning.
